reports.suggestion_message:
To solve this problem, you can try the following approaches:


- Some affected dependencies have newer versions available.
You may want to consider updating them to a newer version to see if the issue has been fixed.

wasmparser v0.78.2 has the following newer versions available: 0.79.0, 0.80.0, 0.80.1, 0.80.2, 0.81.0, 0.82.0, 0.83.0, 0.84.0, 0.85.0, 0.86.0, 0.87.0, 0.88.0, 0.89.0, 0.89.1, 0.90.0, 0.91.0, 0.92.0, 0.93.0, 0.94.0, 0.95.0, 0.96.0, 0.97.0, 0.98.1, 0.99.0, 0.100.0, 0.101.0, 0.101.1, 0.102.0, 0.103.0, 0.104.0, 0.105.0, 0.106.0, 0.107.0, 0.108.0, 0.109.0, 0.110.0, 0.111.0, 0.112.0, 0.113.0, 0.113.1, 0.113.2, 0.113.3, 0.114.0, 0.115.0, 0.116.0, 0.116.1, 0.117.0, 0.118.0, 0.118.1, 0.118.2, 0.119.0, 0.120.0, 0.121.0, 0.121.1, 0.121.2, 0.200.0, 0.201.0, 0.202.0, 0.203.0, 0.204.0, 0.205.0, 0.206.0, 0.207.0, 0.208.0, 0.208.1, 0.209.0, 0.209.1, 0.210.0, 0.211.0, 0.211.1, 0.212.0, 0.213.0, 0.214.0, 0.215.0, 0.216.0, 0.217.0, 0.218.0, 0.219.0, 0.219.1, 0.220.0, 0.221.0, 0.221.1, 0.221.2, 0.222.0, 0.223.0


- If the issue is not solved by updating the dependencies, a fix has to be
implemented by those dependencies. You can help with that by notifying the
maintainers of this problem (e.g. by creating a bug report) or by proposing a
fix to the maintainers (e.g. by creating a pull request):

  - wasmparser@0.78.2
  - Repository: https://github.com/bytecodealliance/wasm-tools/tree/main/crates/wasmparser
  - Detailed warning command: `cargo report future-incompatibilities --id 1 --package wasmparser@0.78.2`

- If waiting for an upstream fix is not an option, you can use the `[patch]`
section in `Cargo.toml` to use your own version of the dependency. For more
information, see:
https://doc.rust-lang.org/cargo/reference/overriding-dependencies.html#the-patch-section
